title: scanned in newspaper
content:
Hello,

this little beauty was scanned in “Le courrier International”  
I hope one of you experts can name it as my usual identification methods have all failed...

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [type.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007183158/http:/typophile.com/files/type_11.gif) | 17.43 KB |

 [‹ Funky slab serif "Cake Cafe"](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007183158/http:/www.typophile.com/node/33749 "Go to previous forum topic") [Undefeated Slab Serif with Tuscan Bulges? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007183158/http:/www.typophile.com/node/33578 "Go to next forum topic")
author: john good

comments.content:
Absolutely.  
Amazing how good it is, even in small sizes.

Thanks.  
+
I’ve long been a fan too.

Stephen means he has been and still is!

Nick Cooke
It works so well at small sizes, because it was designed to work at small sizes. The fact that it is fun at large sizes, I think is secondary. :^)
